disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 1 March to end of Tuesday 1 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A chiefly overcast day for Tuesday with a light breeze drawing up air from the near Continent.<br/><br/>Back-trajectories show the air arriving in London for most of Tuesday to have travelled over rural areas of France. However, air that has passed at low altitude over Paris is forecast to arrive locally during the afternoon and this might import some particulate pollution.  <br/><br/>Air pollution is though expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 2 March to end of Wednesday 2 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Air from Continental Europe will continue to arrive in London during Wednesday. <br/><br/>Although this is often associated with significant long-range import of particulates, a pollution episode is not expected in London on Wednesday. This is because the air arriving here will have mainly travelled at high altitude over rural areas. Some limited import may though occur from air passing over Paris.    <br/><br/>Air pollution is currently expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>
